page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The three main areas of habitation in this area are Skellow, Carcroft and Adwick-le-Street.Originally agricultural communities they grew and developed with the opening of the Bullcroft and Brodsworth mines. The former being closed in 1970.The most recent industrial developments in the area relate to the Industrial Estate which covers 570 acres.New housing has developed particularly in Adwick and Skellow.These provide housing for people who work in the nearby towns.These developments have been helped by the fact that the A1(M) London to Edinburgh road ,which links with the M62 runs through the western edge of this area. The fly_over at the intersection of the Doncaster by-pass with the A638 Doncaster to Wakefield road was built only in 1979.
